shiftCdrTab
Class AttendanceRecord

java.lang.Object
  shiftCdrTab.AttendanceRecord

public class AttendanceRecord
extends java.lang.Object

The AttendanceRecord class represents a single personnel attendance record. An AttendanceRecord represents a single occurrence of an employee's non-presence at roll call. This applies to personnel who are out sick, on leave, in training, etc (Including dispatchers and security division personnel). These are recorded by the Shift Commander at the beginning of each shift during roll call and reviewed and finalized on the Shift Commander Summary Report at the end of the shift. A list of zero or more AttendanceRecords comprises the attendance list for a particular shift. There is exactly one attendance list in every ShiftCdrReport. The list and the AttendanceRecords comprising the list are unique to the shift that the ShiftCdrReport represents. Once it has been created, an AttendanceRecord is attached to and may be referenced in relation to both the shift it pertains to as well as the employee it concerns. An employee may view all AttendanceRecords pertaining to him, but only a Supervisor or the Shift Commander who created the record may edit or remove it. The permissions attached to an AttendanceRecord are as follows: Officers - can view only their own AttendanceRecords Shift Commanders - can view all AttendanceRecords, but can edit only those which they have created Supervisor - can view and edit all AttendanceRecords

See Also:
ShiftCdrReport
